game_name: Metal Frog Solid : Road to Revenge
game_description: It's about time a certain frog has their revenge! Buckle up for a large dose of first person mayhem as you become Metal Frog Solid. Rack up damage, complete revenge tasks, unlock new levels, and fulfill your destiny to become a God of the Metalverse. Get that adrenaline coursing through those webbed hands with different metal music in each level. Go the extra mile with endless mode and see just how much you can handle as it ramps up. Work your way up the leaderboards and compare with friends. Whip around vehicles with your solid metal tongue, blast 'em out of your zone with an energy blast, or launch a missile their way. Dodge cars throughout by jumping lane to lane. In Summary - Eat Metal - Make Go Boom - Don't Get Smooshed Thanks for supporting a small first time game studio!
review_1: Never thought I would be playing a Frogger type game in VR, but here it is. This time the frog is back with a vengeance. The game was a little tricky at first to get the hang of the moves, but once you do its a walk in the park to control. The gameplay made me feel like I was a kid again back in the arcades, but this time inside the world. Moving from lane to lane and trashing cars with your powers. Its a fun VR title that's simple and fun to play, melts the time away. If you are looking for some classic arcade vibes in VR, this game is for you.
review_2: This is a great game your a frog that eats metal to get a bionic metal Tongue that can whip and throw cars like crazy and you have like a energy blast or missiles to knock them away while you try to dodge and survive the onslaught of cars as they try to smash you This game is alil difficult at first but itâ€™s fun enough to have you going back for another go trying to survive till the end and get all the challenges while doing so With some unique tongue mechanics having me head banging and shaking my head like crazy to slam cars into the ground and other cars causing destruction all around me While I dodged cars in a way that gave me some nostalgic frogger vibes
